name: Marine Hotel

reviews.text: Just back from a trip to Dublin staying in the Marine hotel, Sutton in Dublin. We booked this hotel in error as we booked through a third party so we were a bit apprehensive about where we were going to end up. Fortunately on arrival we were pleasantly surprised. Although the hotel looks a bit dated from the front the reception was clean and welcoming. The room was very spacious and there was plenty of room for my family of five. the furniture is dated but that was no big deal. The gardens were lovely and there was a pool but unfortunately that is most of the positives. We went to the pool on the first night. Its one pool and ranges from 1m to 1.7m deep so unless your children are confident in water the pool is a big no no. There is no real shallow end and there is no childrens pool. The toilets are not in the changing rooms which is really annoying when you have to drag a 2 and 3 year old out into the entrance hall to use the bathroom. There is a steam room which smells of really stinky feet and a sauna.
reviews.title: alright but not great

reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning is ok. There is a round pillar where there are literally plates of food, from wheaten bread and croissants, cheeses and cereal and a table of juices. Breakfast is nice but really short staffed and takes a long time to be replenished. Cooked breakfast has to be ordered but takes really long to come, best to order as soon as you arrive. Dinner in the bar is pretty expensive and again short staffed and takes really long to get served. The poor fellas were sweating trying to attend everyone. It was 8 euros for a basic kids meal and up to 14 if they wanted a starter and dessert. Adult meals were lovely but had no choice of side order for a 14 euro meal. We were lucky we had really good weather and were able to sit outside in the garden and play with the kids. If there was bad weather we would have been lost. Lovely area but hotel needs updating and better staffed.
reviews.title: my daughters wedding

reviews.text: My daughter had her wedding reception with you on 1stJune 2013 and I just wanted to compliment you and all your staff for such a terrific day. From start to finish – your staff were exceptional in there dealing with the guests. I work with the public and am very aware as to how challenging it can be at times ! and how you always hear complaints rather than compliments. I would not hesitate in recommending your hotel and I thank you most sincerely for giving us treasured memories of the most important day in our lives. My daughter availed of the package deal and all of the people involved in that were also extremely professional in their dealings with us.
reviews.title: Another excellent stay at this gem of a hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed four nights and, once again, excellent value with a brilliant view. Great Irish breakfast included. Easy access to Dublin centre and great hikes around Howth peninsula. Thanks again to the staff.
reviews.title: My son's wedding reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from a weekend stay at this hotel for my son's wedding. He held the reception here. We arrived from Manchester at this hotel at about 9 am just to drop our luggage off as we knew book in time was 2.00 pm but we were given the rooms straight away. The rooms are clean and had everything including iron. ironing board, hair dryer, shampoo. shower gel etc. We had a sea view that was amazing. The food was most probably the best we have had in a hotel and the staff could not do enough for you. Trying to think of one negative but can't apart from we had to go home after 2 days. We will definately go back again. Howth is a nearby fishing village and a must to visit. Well done Marine Hotel!!!
reviews.title: Anniversary stay at The Marine Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a short Valentine's day trip. We were 100% pleased with this hotel. The room was nice, clean, and we had a beautiful view of the bay. The staff was very friendly, and let us check in several hours early after traveling all night. The Howth area was wonderful!! I would recommend this hotel to anybody.
reviews.title: We Loved The Marine Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel in a beautiful location overlooking Dublin Bay.
reviews.title: Very good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ambience and service were of a higher standard than a 3 star hotel and the room, if not brand new, was confortable and had a lovely sea view. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. The only deceiving thing was about the leisure centre: no relaxing area at all
reviews.title: Pluses and Minuses

reviews.text: to have a rest on a bed after a sauna session or a swim in the swimming pool...
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Anyway very good value for money: the winter offers were really fabulous!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with scenic views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel deserves more than a 3 (average) but can not (for ovbious reasons) give it a four (very goog) - it was good
reviews.title: A bit dissappointed

reviews.text: Based on previous reviews and the manager responding I booked this hotel for our four night stay in Ireland, sadly I was dissappointed, perhaps my expectations were greater.
reviews.title: Friendly, fun and fabulous value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The positives:
reviews.title: Lovely views over Dublin Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable, reasonably sized bedroom with a lovely view though the trees down over the lawn to the sea with ferries crossing clearly visible in the distance. Bathroom was of a good size with supply of toileteries.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, so near to the ferry too. Be back next year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall cleanliness was good.
reviews.title: Outstanding facilities for a 3-star hotel; Exceptionally good value

reviews.text: A lovely hotel, excellent service, especialy from the waitresses at breakfast. The waiting staff were accomodating and helpful. I had an excellent family room, 123, but my sisters, who also travelled with their young children were not so fortunate. Both of them chose a family room, with a double and a single, had only a tiny window and was rather cramped. They were a bit put out as they were paying the same rate as myself, as I booked the hotel for us all, I think they were suspiscious!
reviews.title: Good breakfast, beds, location and excellent service... shame about the steam room (out of service)

reviews.text: Steam room out of order, unfortunately. Nice pool and sauna was lovely.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, would stay again

reviews.text: We enjoyed our recent 3 day stay at the Marine Hotel. It is located on Dublin Bay about a 10 miles from the city center. It has a wonderful view of the Dublin Bay and the Hill Of Howth. Our room was a family room although it was a bit on the small side compared to other family rooms I have stayed at. The bathroom was also small but very clean as was the bedroom. We had a lovely view over the gardens at the back of the hotel. It also has a really nice swimming pool onsite. Each day there is a carvery lunch served in the bar which we went to on several occasions and each time enjoyed a very good meal with a great selection of roasted joints, salmon, vegetables etc. Most of the people there appeared to be locals and not residents of the hotel. The bar/lounge at the back of the hotel is very bright and spacious but the chairs and upholstery are very worn and stained, way past their sell by date. It really takes from the room itself when you are taken aback by the appearance of the chair you are about to sit in. I would hope this is something they are looking into upgrading soon as it is definitely something that needs to be done. For the most part, the staff were friendly and helpful except when we tried to extend our stay. I checked first that the room was available for one more night and was told by the person on duty it was but she could not give me the rate I already had as it was a Friday and on weekends you can only book a room if you include breakfast, there are no room only options. I found this strange and as there were 4 of us the cost of the room for one more night with breakfast would have been almost double the rate we already had. I have on many occasions stayed an extra night or two at a hotel and always got it for the same rate I already had. When we got the chance later to check online, I discovered that I could book “room only” on that Friday so we were kind of annoyed that there was no effort made on behalf of this staff member to accommodate us for another night. Usually you will get a “let me see what I can do” but not in this case. In saying that I would stay there again as overall we really liked the hotel, the food, and the location is ideal for taking a trip into Dublin City by either rail (about a 5 minute walk) or by bus which is right outside.
reviews.title: Marine means value

reviews.text: Good short break option for family stay. Rooms fine and bar meals and breakfast up to scratch. kids enjoyed pool but it could do with a refurb. Location good base for trips to Howth and Malahide and DART rail station only 5 mins walk away for 25 mins trip to Dublin city centre
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We've stayed at the Marine Hotel regularly over the last 5 years when visiting family. The Marine is located in the suburb of Sutton overlooking the sea (so not, as others have said, in central Dublin). There is loads of free parking and the Dart into central Dublin isn't far to walk. The Marine is the kind of hotel that locals meet for coffee and a chat or take their mum for Sunday lunch, the staff are hard working and friendly, the reception welcoming. The rooms are always clean and the beds comfortable.
reviews.title: A dissapointment on our last night in Ireland

reviews.text: I brought my parents here for a special occasion as I had a lovely a la carte meal here previously. I was disappointed to find that the food was carvery when we arrived, as it was a Sunday afternoon. However our disappointment was short lived as we had the nicest roast beef we have ever tasted. The portion sizes were incredibly generous, and the gravy, potatoes and red cabbage were also delicious. I'd say it was the nicest carvery I've had in a long time. The price justifies the portion size. We'll be back
reviews.title: Food review

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for a few nights would stay again.The hotel is easy to get to has a good large carpark its close to sutton dart station and bus routes to airport and dublin.Staff very professional and friendly.hotel in a nice location with good views over dublin bay Has a nice terrace and garden at rear.Food excellent in both bar and resturant. Hotel pool very good .Rooms clean and comfortable.A hidden gem in north dublin.
reviews.title: a lovely place to stay

reviews.text: Lovely staff, good food and a great setting. Though I was working during my stay I found the experience most enjoyable. Wi-fi worked very well throughout the hotel. DART station nearby so you can abandon the car if you need to travel to the city centre
reviews.title: Most enjoyable

reviews.text: My family recently stayed at this hotel on a visit to Dublin. The hotel is close to Dublin Airport and a Dart station that will take you to the city centre is just a five minute walk down the road. We ate in the restaurant that night and both the food and service was excellent and reasonably priced also. The bedrooms are average but could do with a few touch ups. The hotel also has a sauna, steam room and swimming pool.
reviews.title: Good hotel in North Dublin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently had lunch in this hotel, having been there for lunch after a funeral a couple of weeks ago we thought we would return and sample their carvery. We were sorry we did. The young man serving the food was very friendly although we thought he could do with some help, he asked me if I wanted a half portion (which I did). I had lamb which looked nice and was well cooked and tender, but had very little flavour. The roast potatoes appeared to be deep fried, pale and slightly crisp on the outside but not fully cooked inside. My husband had fish and chips, he was told the chips would be a few minutes which was fine, but when they arrived, they looked more like oven chips and the batter was soggy although the fish inside was fine. All the salads and cold meats, plus cold salmon, looked very fresh and appetising. There is rather a clunky way of getting your dessert and tea/coffee - you get them in the bar instead of the carvery section.
reviews.title: Disappointing lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Marine Sutton for short break - very comfortable bedroom, friendly staff and good breakfast. WiFi in public areas but none in bedroom. Swimming pool was good and that area well maintained - there is a nice area at the back of the hotel but the flower beds could do with some gardening care.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.text: This is an old world hotel with a lovely relaxed atmosphere about the place. The rooms were spacious and the one I was in had sea views. The only down side is that the wifi didn't work in the bedroom and I had to go to the bar. It did work in the lobby but the French doors to the back gardens were open and I found it a little chilly there. The hotel has beautiful gardens and a patio area to sit out in and the beach is close by. It is situated right in the village of Sutton, a short walk from the DART station. Howth and all it scenery is a DART stop further along the line or a good 40 minute walk. We ate is the hotel on the first night and in the Chinese (The Golden Elephant) across the road on the 2nd night. Both were very good but service in the hotel was slow. Didn't use the pool so can't comment
reviews.title: Scenic location

reviews.text: We recently had a family get together in the Marine Hotel. Some of the family travelled so they stayed and the rooms look great, comfortable, clean and modern, there is also a swimming pool and the most amazing views across Dublin Bay to Dun Laoghaire and beyond to the Sugar Loaf. The food in the restaurant was excellent, great value but really tasty. The staff are really friendly and we felt a huge amount of personal attention with each one wanting to make our event special (even though it was just a small gathering). We finished with drinks on the beautiful lawn which runs right down to the beach - and did I mention the view, you could be in the Mediterranean but Ireland is nicer.
reviews.title: Great venue for family get together and what a view

reviews.text: Great place to visit, free wifi and stunning views. Really want to go back
reviews.title: Most Enjoyable !!!!!

reviews.text: Arrived to the hotel after a very busy day and long journey. Reception and check in was great, very helpful and informative. The room was great, shower a little dates but ok. View was incredible and a calm evening to add to the view. Breakfast was great also and next trip to Dublin and the surrounds I will be staying there again!!!!!
reviews.title: Great seaside hotel, lovely building, friendly staff, but systems are rubbish.

reviews.text: This is a standard 3 star hotel in a beautiful if remote part of Dublin but it does have transport services close by. The reason I put but in my title refers to room noise levels. On entering our room the sound of extractors or some sort of motors outside was very evident. I had requested in my booking "away from noise" so I went to reception immediately. The staff were very helpful but there wasn't another family room available except on the floor below which the girl said was nearer the noise. She told me to ring reception around 21.30 and they would ensure the fans were turned off. I called at 22.30 but the noise didn’t stop until around midnight and started again early in the morning. I cannot accept that the management do not know about these noise levels as many rooms are situated above and around this area. I complained again the following day, after a sleepless night, and we were moved to another area …..great result as all was quiet.
reviews.title: Nice but ..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food service in the bar took about 45 mins to an hour during our stay and ordering cooked breakfast was very slow also....but the food was very nice when it finally arrived.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All staff we encountered were very pleasant
reviews.title: Wedding Anniversary treat

reviews.text: Stayed three nights on a BB basis. Our room was comfortable and clean but in need of upgrading, very old TV and furniture and no wi fi, toilet cistern took forever to refill. All staff we met were friendly but the bar lounge staff were very busy on two occasions and the resultant service was very slow. What I presume to be the Manager was around but he did not take any action or engage with us. We had bar food on our first night, eat out on the second and used the hotel restuarant on the third, no complaints in fact the restuaruant food and service was very good. We had breakfast early on all three days and again found no complaint, good cold buffet selection and hot cooked breakfast to order. The hotel is in a very good location, close to the Dart, local shops and the lovely Howth harbour and town where there a number of bars, shops and restuarants. All in all good value.
reviews.title: Lovely staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked two nights bed and breakfast in the Marine Hotel on our way home from spending a week in Italy.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a double room including breakfast for €75, which we thought was great value. The room itself was decent enough. The bed was comfy. It had tea/coffee facilities, ironing board, telly was old but adequate. The views over Dublin Bay were breathtaking. On arrival the room was stiflingly warm. The heat was on in the room. However, not really their fault. The weather has been freakishly warm for late September this year ! Didn't take long to cool down the room, by opening the windows to let in some fresh sea air ! The receptionist on arrival and departure was very polite. The bar in the hotel is nice. The bar food is delicious. Very very nice. I had BLT and chips and it was exceptional. Highly recommended. The only minuses to the place were that there was a musty smell in the corridors to the bedrooms. I think the smell was coming from the carpets. Another thing I find amazing is that the carpetted floor to the bar/lounge area is always filthy. I can't understand this. This is always the same, crumbs and papers everywhere. It really lets the place down. Someone should be hoovering up after meal finish at 9.30pm. The staff seem to work very hard, and are pleasant. One of them needs to use a hoover though ! The breakfast was very nice. Overall great value for the price that we paid. We come here regularly for a Saturday night drink, and we will consider staying over occasionally based on the reasonable price that we paid, and the fact that the staff are nice
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.text: We used the Marine Hotel recently for a group booking for two nights (32 resident and 8 coming in for the day) for a Reunion of friends who were all part of a church young people's group some decades ago. It proved to be a perfect venue for our purpose and was in a lovely setting by Dublin Bay. The manager and his staff could not have been more helpful in the planning of the event or while we were all there. The rooms were spacious and clean. The meals were all good. As the lead organiser of the event, I received unanimously positive feedback from group members and am very happy to commend the Marine to anybody organising such a group event in the Dublin area.
reviews.title: Great place for a group event!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We first stayed at The Marine Hotel in May this year - see my previous review. Since then, we have paid return visits in the middle of July and the end of August. I just thought that I would write this further short review to confirm the excellent, friendly and accommodating service. We'll certainly return.
reviews.title: Third time staying at The Marine Hotel. Consistently excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: lovely hotel good location lovely staff very helpfull
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a lot going for it. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The bar has nice character, and has as many locals as hotel guests which says a lot about the bar! The food is good if you are not looking for fine dining, but they were just beginning to remodel the dining room and kitchen as we were leaving so that could change. The staff was extremely accommodating.
reviews.title: Very Nice Accommodations, We Will Stay There Again

description: Marine Hotel's guests can browse complimentary newspapers in the lobby, go for a dip in the indoor pool, and relax in the sauna and steam room. Business guests can benefit from conference rooms, and those arriving by car will find complimentary parking onsite. Further practical amenities include a 24-hour front desk, a safe-deposit box and a dry cleaning service.
